Analysis of Mercator v. Heritrix v. HTTrack

URLs                     Mercator   Heritrix  %_of_files col2-col3
crawl08.archive.org         24         31      77.42%         -7

URLs                     HTTrack    Heritrix  %_of_files col2-col3
crawl08.archive.org         25         31      80.65%         -6

The main difference between the three crawlers is that Heritrix crawled a 
page disallowed by robots.txt.  However, there was a bug in the robots.txt 
file rather than the Heritrix crawler code.  Thus, the Heritrix crawler 
seems to be operating correctly.  

Heritrix Got Mercator Did Not
-----------------------------
Mercator did not find a page where there were spaces in the 
filename.  It seems to have chopped off the rest of the filename after the 
space, and when Mercator tried to find that file, it resulted in a 404:
Mercator
crawl08.archive.org/links/spaces
Heritrix
crawl08.archive.org/links/spaces%20in%20path.html
This page was the only valid page that Heritrix got that Mercator did not.  

Other Pages
---------------
The remaining pages that Heritrix got that Mercator and HTTrack did not, 
all returned 404 response codes.  Furthermore, the one page difference 
between Mercator and HTTrack was that HTTrack got the robots.txt file and Mercator did not.

Overall, Heritrix seems to be doing well in terms of coverage of the 
EasyGarden. 


Judy
